title: The flood that drowned American dreams
description: Immigrant deaths in New York's floods lay bare the 'climate apartheid' wrought by extreme weather.

title: Should you date someone based on their music taste?
description: Finding love through music, the app matching-up couples based on their 'emotional profiles'.

title: Health funding cut said to threaten levelling up
description: Grants for councils to fund healthy-lifestyle support have fallen by a quarter in six years.

title: First new treatment for sickle cell in 20 years
description: The hope of reducing health inequalities for black people made it worth recommending, the regulator says.

title: Migrants risking death trying to get to England in a pedalo
description: Film maker Julien Goudichaud follows young migrants as they go to extreme lengths to try to reach the UK.

title: One of the darkest moments in Brazilian football - and the divide that still runs deep
description: A home Copa America in 1989 became a flashpoint in north-eastern Brazil's persistent struggles with prejudice and poverty.

title: Pumpkin farmer 'started with one pack of seeds'
description: Chris Hoggard started growing pumpkins for his children but now produces more than 30,000 a year.

title: Salah is better than Messi and Ronaldo - Sutton
description: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah "is the best player in the world" at the moment, says former Blackburn striker Chris Sutton.

title: Pandora Papers: Questions over Tory donations by ex-Russian minister's wife
description: Documents reveal the scale of the secret offshore financial wealth she shares with her husband.

title: NHS dentistry access delays: 'I pulled 11 of my own teeth out'
description: Dentists warn of waits of up to four years to join an NHS dental practice.

title: Russian linked to Tory funding made millions from 'fraud'
description: Victor Fedotov is awaiting government approval for a controversial energy link between UK and France.

title: David Walliams: 'Harmful' Chinese character removed from children's book
description: Children's author David Walliams has been criticised for using "harmful stereotypes" of a Chinese boy.

title: Metropolitan Police officer accused of raping woman he met on Tinder
description: PC David Carrick, 46, appears in court charged with raping a woman in Hertfordshire.

title: Military starts fuel deliveries to boost supplies
description: About 200 military personnel will help out as fuel supply problems in some areas continue.

title: Covid: Amber list scrapped as travel rules simplified
description: The changes will make it easier and cheaper for people to travel abroad, industry groups say.

title: Rishi Sunak: No magic wand to solve supply problems
description: The chancellor says ministers are doing what they can to mitigate disruption to food and fuel supplies.

title: How we feel touch research wins Nobel Prize
description: US scientists David Julius and Ardem Patapoutian share the 2021 prize in Physiology or Medicine.

title: Fury v Wilder III: Tyso Fury calls Deontay Wilder 'dangerous' and an 'atomic bomb'
description: Deontay Wilder is an "atomic bomb" of a fighter and the "most dangerous heavyweight out there" says Tyson Fury as he prepares for their trilogy fight.

title: Ashes: England to make Australia tour decision this week
description: Some England players have concerns over whether families can travel, quarantine arrangements and any potential 'bubbles'.

title: Reynhard Sinaga: Victim of UK's most prolific rapist speaks out
description: Daniel is the first victim of serial rapist Reynhard Sinaga to waive his right to anonymity.

title: Lars Vilks: Muhammad cartoonist killed in traffic collision
description: Lars Vilks, who caricatured the Prophet Muhammad, was under police protection when his car hit a truck.

title: Billie Eilish to headline Glastonbury Festival in 2022
description: The US singer will be the festival's youngest ever solo headliner at the age of 20.

title: John Barrowman to leave Dancing on Ice
description: But ITV says the actor and presenter will continue to host its All Star Musicals specials.

title: Liverpool 2-2 Man City: Why Reds got away with it - Jermaine Jenas
description: MOTD2 pundit Jermaine Jenas says only big moments and big decisions helped Liverpool get a point against Manchester City on Sunday.

title: Could changes to Formula 1 attract another new car company?
description: Formula 1 is inching towards an agreement on a new engine design to be used from 2026 - and it could tempt the Volkswagen Group to join the grid.

title: Pandora Papers: Why are donations to political parties often so controversial?
description: The Pandora Papers leak has once again cast a spotlight on the funding of UK political parties by wealthy donors.

title: Pandora Papers: Tory donor Mohamed Amersi involved in telecoms corruption scandal
description: Businessman involved in deals for a firm that was fined $965m for bribery, a BBC investigation finds.

title: The Papers: Financial data leak, and police 'social media sickness'
description: Many of Monday's papers lead with the Pandora Papers data leak, exposing world leaders' secret wealth.

title: Frances Haugen: Facebook whistleblower reveals identity
description: Facebook ex-product manager Frances Haugen says the company prioritises "growth over safety".
